intro: Euphrasia gibbsiae subsp. wellingtonensis, commonly known as the Wellington's eyebright, is a perennial herb native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
